newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end firm, resistance persists.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end firm, resistance persists.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended higher on Tuesday as late buying of blue chip issues boosted the underlying cash market, but dealers said further gains were likely to be slow.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 March contract added 275 points to close 10 points off its intra-day high of 19,150.
"It's mainly speculative buying and selling now. I think most people have just squared up ahead of the Japanese financial year end," said a trader with a local futures house.
He said the March Nikkei showed more room on the upside technically, but it would need to break above a stubborn barrier around 19,200 to head higher.
On the downside, a breach of the 18,800 level would cause the contract to come off further, he said.
Dealers said the results of a 10-year Japanese government bond auction had little impact on the Nikkei as they left the bond market largely unmoved.
The March MSCI Taiwan stock index ended at 327.6 against its opening 329.5 on volume of 627 lots.
